intro: Habracanthus corei, commonly known as the Korean habracanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. It is relatively rare and has limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
